pr_title: fix(ios): return error if Cancel is selected from Camera.getPhoto() prompt

timeline.message: fix error not being shown when 'Cancel' is selected from prompt

timeline.bodyText:
Better just call the error directly

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  self.imagePickerControllerDidCancel(self.imagePicker!)
          
          
            
                  self.call?.error("User cancelled photos app")
          
      
    
    
  

imagePickerControllerDidCancel should only be called by the delegate, and also it dismiss the imagePicker, but at this point it has not been presented.
timeline.author: jcesarmobile
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -111,7 +111,7 @@ public class CAPCameraPlugin : CAPPlugin, UIImagePickerControllerDelegate, UINav
     }))
 
     alert.addAction(UIAlertAction(title: "Cancel", style: .cancel, handler: { (action: UIAlertAction) in
-      alert.dismiss(animated: true, completion: nil)
+      self.imagePickerControllerDidCancel(self.imagePicker!)
